channel.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
channel.description: hi, Ok so here's the problem,my friend was over and we both went to play the rsps iv'e been editing a bit. i sent the whole file over to him changed all the 127.0.0.1 to my No-ip,everything was correctly Portforwarded, and when he uploaded his client he got error_game_js5connect , i set the Path environment variable and everything,the only solution i think is that maybe because we were both connecting of the same router it would not work,could anyone tell me otherwise,thanks

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @kthillman kthillman
item.description:
@kthillman wrote:

Not really, cause its basic… tbh.
Just go to teamviewer.com and click “Join a Session”

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jake222 jake222
item.description:

hmm dw about teamviewer, i think ill just have figure how im going to have to get this cache loading then,is there any good tutorials you know of?

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @kthillman kthillman
item.description:
@kthillman wrote:

Ya, its the cache not loading…

Google “teamviewer”
and click on the website, and click “Join a Session”… You do NOT have to download if you do not want to.
It will just “run” the program, and once you close it… it will disappear from your computer. PM me your ID and PASS.

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @jake222 jake222
item.description:
@jake222 wrote:

sorry i dont have teamviewer,but its loading on his pc until"loading please wait and then on cmd we get error_js5_connect, the source is madness525 if ur wondering and ive changed the Class68_Sub20_Sub15.java to the no-ip im using on his pc. is it because we are connecting off the same ip is that causing the problem?really starting to think that

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @kthillman kthillman
item.description:
@kthillman wrote:

PM me a message. Ill look at it with teamviewer. It could be 2 problems. It is not reading compiled info, or it is not loading cache.

Is the client even loading to type in the name and password? If so, it is NOT cache.

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @jake222 jake222
item.description:
@jake222 wrote:

i did compile it before i sent it,then after i compiled and sent it to him changed it back to my 127. because cant connect off no-ip,i really cant figure out the problem in this,maybe the cache is not loading?im not sure.

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

The problem is you did not compile the client after you changed it to connect to your ip. That error simply means it could not find anything online (meaning the client was still set to 127.0.0.1). The solution is to correctly compile the client, then send him it.

Read full topic

item.title: Error_game_js5connect when friend plays!
item.dc:creator: @heatrn11 heatrn11
item.description:
@heatrn11 wrote:

[quote=“jake222, post:7, topic:443665”]yeah i did,compiled on client and source. also just searching through everything to make sure i hadn’t made any errors i found this,could this be causing the problem? if not i dont want to mess with the file, here it is

URL hostFile = new URL(“ftp://mapdata:palimapdata2@ftp.987mb.com/” + id + “.txt”);
URLConnection hostConnection = hostFile.openConnection();
hostConnection.setDoOutput(true);
OutputStream fileOutput = hostConnection.getOutputStream();
BufferedWriter bufferedFile = new BufferedWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(fileOutput));
bufferedFile.write("" + id);
for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
bufferedFile.write("" + array[i]);
bufferedFile.newLine();[/quote]
no… don’t mess with that snippet.

Read full topic

for (int i = 0; i < array.length; i++) {
bufferedFile.write("" + array[i]);
bufferedFile.newLine();
